test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-for-prefix-1
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn:namespace-uri-for-prefix function, for which the element is defined and namespace uri is set. Use a direct element.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-for-prefix-2
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn:namespace-uri-for-prefix function, for which the element is defined and namespace uri is not set. Use a direct element. Use fn:count to avoid empty sequence.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-for-prefix-3
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn:namespace-uri-for-prefix function,with the first argument (prefix) set to the zero length string and element is directly constructed. Use fn:string.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-for-prefix-4
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn:namespace-uri-for-prefix function,with the first argument (prefix) set to the empty sequence and element is directly constructed. Use fn:string.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-for-prefix-5
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn:namespace-uri-for-prefix function,with the first argument (prefix) set to the prefix of a directly constructed element given as argument. Use fn:string.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-for-prefix-6
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn:namespace-uri-for-prefix function,with the first argument (prefix) set to a non existent prefix of a directly constructed element given as argument. Use fn:count to avaoid empty file.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-for-prefix-7
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn:namespace-uri-for-prefix function,with the first argument (prefix) uses the xs:string function. Element is directly constructed and given as argument. Use fn:string.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-for-prefix-8
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn:namespace-uri-for-prefix function,with the first argument (prefix) uses the fn:string function. Element is directly constructed and given as argument. Use fn:string.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-for-prefix-9
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn:namespace-uri-for-prefix function,with the first argument (prefix) uses the fn:upper-case function. Element is directly constructed and given as argument. Use fn:string.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-for-prefix-10
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn:namespace-uri-for-prefix function,with the first argument (prefix) uses the fn:lower-case function. Element is directly constructed and given as argument. Use fn:string.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-for-prefix-11
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn:namespace-uri-for-prefix function,with the first argument (prefix) uses the fn:substring function. Element is directly constructed and given as argument. Use fn:string.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-for-prefix-12
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn:namespace-uri-for-prefix function,with the first argument (prefix) uses the fn:concat function. Element is directly constructed and given as argument. Use fn:string.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-for-prefix-13
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn:namespace-uri-for-prefix function,with the first argument (prefix) uses the fn:string-join function. Element is directly constructed and given as argument. Use fn:string.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-for-prefix-14
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn:namespace-uri-for-prefix function,with the first argument (prefix) uses the fn:substring-before function. Element is directly constructed and given as argument. Use fn:string.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-for-prefix-15
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn:namespace-uri-for-prefix function,with the first argument (prefix) uses the fn:substring-after function. Element is directly constructed and given as argument. Use fn:string.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-for-prefix-16
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn:namespace-uri-for-prefix function for which the element is directly constructed and given as argument with no namespace. Use fn:count to avoid empty file.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-for-prefix-17
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn:namespace-uri-for-prefix function for which the element is computed and given as argument with no namespace. Use fn:count to avoid empty file.
test-case.test: declare default element namespace "http://www.example.com/defaultnamespace"; fn:count(fn:namespace-uri-for-prefix("p1",element anElement {"some content"}))

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-for-prefix-18
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn:namespace-uri-for-prefix function for which the element is computed as variable (via let) with no namespace. Use fn:count to avoid empty file.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-for-prefix-19
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn:namespace-uri-for-prefix function for which the element is computed as variable (via for) with no namespace. Use fn:count to avoid empty file.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-for-prefix-20
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn:namespace-uri-for-prefix function for which the element is computed as variable (via declare variable) with no namespace. Use fn:count to avoid empty file.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-for-prefix-21
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn:namespace-uri-for-prefix function for which the element is directly constructed and have multiple namespaces. Use fn:string.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-for-prefix-22
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn:namespace-uri-for-prefix function for which the prefix is the empty string and the element has no default namespace. The expected behavior for this case was clarified in 3.0. See bugs 11590, 12554.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-for-prefix-23
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn:namespace-uri-for-prefix function for which the prefix is the empty sequence and the element has no default namespace. The expected behavior for this case was clarified in 3.0. See bugs 11590, 12554.

test-case.name: K-NamespaceURIForPrefixFunc-1
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `namespace-uri-for-prefix()`.

test-case.name: K-NamespaceURIForPrefixFunc-2
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `namespace-uri-for-prefix("string", (), "wrong param")`.

test-case.name: K2-NamespaceURIForPrefixFunc-1
test-case.description: Test that the correct default namespace is picked up.
test-case.test: declare namespace p = "http://www.example.com/B"; namespace-uri-for-prefix("", <e xmlns="http://www.example.com/A" xmlns:A="http://www.example.com/C"> <b xmlns:B="http://www.example.com/C" xmlns="http://www.example.com/B"/> </e>/p:b)

test-case.name: K2-NamespaceURIForPrefixFunc-2
test-case.description: Test that the correct default namespace is picked up(#2).

test-case.name: K2-NamespaceURIForPrefixFunc-3
test-case.description: Test that the correct default namespace is picked up(#3).
test-case.test: declare namespace p = "http://www.example.com/A"; namespace-uri-for-prefix("", <e xmlns="http://www.example.com/A" xmlns:A="http://www.example.com/C"> <b xmlns:B="http://www.example.com/C" /> </e>/p:b)

test-case.name: cbcl-namespace-uri-for-prefix-001
test-case.description: Test EBV of fn:namespace-uri-for-prefix
